results.title: The Most important question in the world
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paul Young went to university, he knew he didn’t want to be a teacher. However, over time, he has seen the value of the profession and learnt that it’s not about the content, it’s about the life lessons.

results.title: The Big if
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Peter Hollander, Kamil Pixa, United Nations and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated satire questioning what our money might be able to be used for if it was not spent on defence weapons. Animated by Boris Masnik.

results.title: The Best time of my life
results.creator_credit: Krystal Webb, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Unpredictability of life...
results.creator_credit: Chris Villarroel, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Chris Villarroel’s family were falling apart his home became his hell and he had no one to talk to. Eventually, Villarroel found solace and happiness in a new family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Villarroel, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Birth of a brain : ten billion galaxies (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claude Edelman, CRM/McGraw-Hill Films and Les Films du Levant
results.brief_description: Looks at the development of the human brain from embryo stage through to the first years of life. Computer graphics, sonography and film of living nerve cells show the process and progress of development at different stages. This is a version of a French documentary, ‘Naissance du cerveau : dix milliards de galaxies’ with a dubbed American commentary.
results.title_for_label: The Birth of a brain : ten billion galaxies (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Edelman, CRM/McGraw-Hill Films and Les Films du Levant
results.description: Looks at the development of the human brain from embryo stage through to the first years of life. Computer graphics, sonography and film of living nerve cells show the process and progress of development at different stages. This is a version of a French documentary, ‘Naissance du cerveau : dix milliards de galaxies’ with a dubbed American commentary.

results.title: Western stories : expressions for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Paul Young, Maria Savarino, Ayen Guinto, Krystal Webb, Marten McEachran, Samantha Sharp, Laura O'Donnell, Chris Villarroel, Dean Sacco, Charles Skoutariotis, Katherine O'Neill, Troy Maguire, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Twelve stories from people from Melbourne’s western suburbs, created at ACMI as part of ‘Western stories : Expressions for the future’ Digital Storytelling project. The participants talk about the things they love and, in doing so, highlight what it is about them that make them unique.

results.title: Dogs
results.creator_credit: Lex Van Os and FM-TV Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Talk to the animals”.
In response to thousands of requests, the producers of Seven Network’s “Talk to the animals” have compiled this videotape for dog lovers of all ages. Now you can enjoy your favourite dog stories from Australia’s most popular television series again and again. Hosted by Dr. Harry Cooper.
results.description:
